availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organized at Paducah, Kentucky, in September, 1863. Consolidated with the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) on Mach 25, 1864. Commander(s): Colonel Quintus C. Shanks, Colonel Eugene W. Crittenden, Lieutenant Colonel Alexander W. Holeman, and Lieutenant Colonel James T. Bramlette (as the 12th). Mustered out with the 12th on August 23, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 352-353, 403.
Frederick H. DyerA Compendium of the War of the Rebellion: Compiled and Arranged from Official Reports of the Federal and Confederate Armies, Reports of the Adjutant Generals of the Several States, the Army Registers, and Other Reliable Documents and Sources(DeMoines, IA: Dyer Publishing Company, 1908), p. 1195.
